intro: Cuphea meionandra, commonly known as the pink cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Cuphea meionandra is drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping.
